name: David Castillo
review: Kick a** burger. Been wanting to try this place for a long time. Cash only. Nice setup and comfortable atmosphere. I had the “Tijuana Torpedo” rare and some fries - “chuck box potatoes” (if you say fries you’re fine). Will be coming back soon.

name: Shawn Logan
review:
A Classic Burger Joint Since 1972

If you're looking for a taste of nostalgia and a truly authentic burger experience, look no further than Chuckbox. Established in 1972, this time-honored eatery has been serving up mouthwatering flamed-kissed burgers that will transport you back in time.

One of the defining features of Chuckbox is its commitment to simplicity - from its no-frills decor to its cash-only policy. While some may find this old-school approach charming, it may not suit those who prefer to pay with plastic.

The star of the show at Chuckbox is, without a doubt, their flame-kissed burgers. Juicy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection, these burgers are a must-try for any burger aficionado. Pair it with their bomb onion rings and fried mushrooms for a truly indulgent meal.

So, if you're in the mood for a classic burger joint experience that has stood the test of time, make sure to swing by Chuckbox. Just remember to bring cash!

name: Sherri Gauspohl
review: Was glad to be able to get a non sesame seed bun! Burger was seasoned good and juicy even though it's thin. Put as much or little condiments you'd like as it's self serve. Onions rings and fries mushrooms were freshly fried and delicious!

name: Ryan Of San Tan Valley
review: Holy!! These burgers are incredible. They cook them fresh in front of your face on a charcoal grill!! You get the fattest, juiciest, most delicious double burger in the world for under $13. 2 half pound patties with cheese, cooked by local college students!! It seriously doesn't get any better than this. Best burger EVER!!

name: Ricky Monroe
review: The Chuckbox in Tempe, AZ, is a local legend and a must-visit for anyone who loves a great burger. This no-frills, cash-only spot has been serving up perfectly grilled burgers over mesquite charcoal for decades, and the flavor is unbeatable. The Chuckbox lets you customize your burger just the way you like it, with fresh toppings and generous portions. The rustic, laid-back atmosphere adds to its charm, making it a favorite hangout for students and locals alike. If you’re in Tempe and craving a top-notch burger, The Chuckbox is where you need to be.

name: R Brooks
review:
One slice of cheese on a double cheeseburger should be criminal.  The onion rings were also 85% batter, 10% air and 5% paper-thin onion.

I’m not sure why they are so stingy with portions?  The price are still relatively high for everything, even with the cash only policy.

name: Rohan Raut
review: The Chuckbox in Tempe is an absolute gem! 🍔 Cash-only policy? No worries—they've got an ATM right on the side. The burgers here? Legendary. Freshly made on charcoal, they boast that perfect juicy charred meat flavor that'll have your taste buds singing! 🎶 Plus, the option to customize your toppings? Brilliant. Whether you're inside or soaking up the sun on the patio, every bite is pure bliss. And parking? Plenty! 🅿️ I'll definitely be back for more of their mouthwatering burgers and that tempting chicken sandwich. Count me in as a returning customer! 🌟

name: James Smith
review:
Overall the best burger I’ve tried in the area. Amazing flavor. A topping bar to build your own burger and delicious fries.

The mesquite charcoal really gives an out of this world flavor that I would kill for locally in Texas.

Absolutely worth the wait and having to get cash.

name: Robert Jones
review:
As usual the burgers are amazing and the fries are perfectly crispy and of all the times I've been here I've never been disappointed. It is absolutely worth the stop even if there's a bit line, they have a good system to keep the lone moving and it's just as good as when it's slower.

Got a double big one with cheese, bacon, fries, and a Kilt Lifter.

name: Chris Scheller
review:
The Chuckbox is an absolute must-visit for burger enthusiasts. The moment you walk in, the aroma of burgers cooking over open coals hits you, promising a culinary experience like no other. The burgers are perfectly cooked, achieving that ideal balance of juiciness and charred flavor that is simply incomparable to other burgers. Each bite is a testament to the art of grilling, making it truly worth the time to stop in for lunch or dinner.

But the deliciousness doesn't stop at the burgers. The onion rings are cooked to perfection, crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, delivering an amazing taste that complements the meal perfectly. And let's not forget the fries—thicker cut and perfectly salted, they add just the right touch to complete an unforgettable dining experience.

Whether you're a local or just passing through, The Chuckbox is a place where exceptional food meets a casual, welcoming atmosphere. Don't miss the chance to enjoy one of the best burger experiences around!

name: Riyad Kalla
review: This burger, fries and a drink was $17.36... for a hole in the wall place that is cash only, paper plates, tables from the 80s, no wait staff and you do everything yourself... why the premium prices? Sort of negates the appeal. Burger was good, no doubt - fries were standard middle of the road fries and soda was, well, soda. I don't get it besides the nostalgia everyone must have for the place.

name: BM22
review:
It's been 20 years since I was here last, and not much has changed, in a good way. Great food, great burger, love the onion rings.
Be ready, cash only, be ready to order, and get pineapple on your burger!
Great place. Glad it is still around.

name: 「john huie」
review:
This is how a hamburger should taste. I think it might be my favorite burger place. Wood coals, perfect amount of char, flavorful, and simple-no crazy frills. Just good simple, BIG burgers. Will definitely keep going back! Too bad it's in Arizona ... I live on the East Coast and will have to keep visiting to enjoy this place. 👍🏾

Update: August 2024- still my favorite burger place. This is how a hamburger should taste! Love it. And get the draft root beer. Very refreshing and goes great with a burger.

name: Rachel Ewell
review: Fun iconic burger experience - line was long but it goes quick! Burger was excellent and fries were delicious! Definitely can understand why they’ve won several best burger awards!

name: David Goh
review: Very nicely grilled burger right in front of you. Ordered a side of battered mushroom which was nice! Will swing by again!

name: Catie Campbell
review: We had a late lunch/early supper at The Chuckbox and OMG it was AMAZING!!! Probably bc we went in the afternoon it wasn’t busy at all. We had great service and it was fun to watch the cook grill up our burgers. Choose your own toppings from the topping bar such a wonderful idea. We really enjoyed our visit to The Chuckbox and we will be back.

name: Krish K
review: The burger patty is grilled live and they have a station available to fill in the add ons (onions,olives,tomatoes etc).Taste is awesome.I ordered a grilled spicy chicken burger.Make sure you are carrying cash they won’t accept any type of cards

name: Paul Rondeau
review: Easily one of the BEST burgers money can buy - a must try! These burgers are unique and charbroiled to perfection. The line ups are worth the wait, the prices are super fair and the food is amazing. You get to enjoy endless toppings and cheap, cold beer on tap. It’s an old school BBQ spot worth visiting. Can’t wait to get back here!

name: Alexander
review:
To be honest not quite sure how to write this review, as my wife and I weren’t overly pleased with the food.

The service was excellent, it might appear off putting because the line is long. But they do a really great job getting the customers through and getting food out. With the amount of raw meat products they handle, you would think of cross contamination but let me tell you they handle all raw products appropriately. They probably used 4-5 different tongs to grab various meats to prevent any contamination.

The atmosphere was a bit off putting, but a lot of had to do with the customers. But because of its location and historic aspect, the dining within is on the smaller side, considering how many customers they get. It didn’t help that customers who had been finished eating remained sitting for another 20 minutes while people were looking for a place to sit, thats neither here nor there.

The food is where the rating really comes from. My wife and I weren’t overly impressed with the taste of the food. We aren’t quite sure how there were so many raving reviews about the food. The hamburgers that we had were not seasoned and tasted that of plain burgers which didn’t impress us. The fried onions were overly fried and sat under a heat lamp, to include the fried zucchini. With the rating it currently holds and the reviews we read, we were expecting some tasty and delicious burgers and unfortunately thats not what we got. Granted I would put it up higher than fast food burgers but for the cost, it wouldn’t cheaper to get fast food.

name: R Len
review: Food and service were amazing. Made it through the long line pretty quickly, placed my order for bacon burger and onion rings. Both were excellent. Bring cash!

name: Kim Krick
review: Loved this place and have gone multiple times and will continue to take visitors! Went during off hours and had front door parking, no line to super short lines. The burgers are so good, nice char and fire grill flavor. Love the build your own bar. Have had the fries and mushroom, both so good. It's a run down your wrist, delicious burger spot.....I get actual cravings! Bring cash, no card service!

name: The Goul
review: best hamburgers I've had in a long time the line is long but it is worth it it goes by real fast

name: Pete Brainard
review: I realize this place is an institution in Tempe so apologies to all the fans, but I was underwhelmed. It’s a grimy place. Kinda gross. But I figured that since the best Mexican food comes from the least sanitary locations, maybe that applies to burgers. Nope. Got the giant with cheddar cheese. Added some condiments from the condiment bar where everyone’s dirty, nasty digits also spoon out ketchup, mustard, pickles, mayo, etc. Not a fan of community condiments. In a nutshell, to me, it’s a hipster Burger King. I honestly didn’t see a huge difference between this burger and a flame broiled whopper. If you love this place, good for you. Enjoy. For me, the hype around this place is

name: Greg Wilson
review: The only thing juicy on my burger was the tomato slice.  If you go ( l won't, again) take cash.  Their ATM ( they own it) charges $2.  Your bank will charge a fee (mine was $3) making my $16 hamburger $21.  The hamburger was dry and the fries were cold.  The condiments were filled and fresh.  The verdict: my first and last time at Chuckbox.

name: Jerome Sayre
review: If you want to experience an original, visit the Chuckbox. It takes you back to your college days. No frills, surrounded by students, just solid burgers and fries cooked your way. Enjoy!
